From: "Barbara Nostrand, PhD" <nostrand@...>

Musashi sided with the Toyotomi=E2=80=99s and the army of the West. They lo=
st. Musashi was among other things at both battles of Osaka castle. It is r=
eally easy to become unemployed when you are on the loosing side and the wi=
nning side is not interested in recruiting your unit. Also, Musashi was a b=
it of jerk. One of Hideyoshi=E2=80=99s problems in 1590 was that he had mor=
e followers than he had turf available to reward them with. This is very li=
kely a major reason for the Korean campaigns. 

As for the Akita, technical=
ly they were not a clan.
